citation.article-title: New types of the acetate-oxidizing, sulfate-reducing Desulfobacter species, D. hydrogenophilus sp. nov., D. latus sp. nov., and D. curvatus sp. nov.

p.s: Description of Desulfobacter hydrogenophilus sp. nov.

Desulfobacter hydrogenophilus (hy.dro.ge.no'phi.lus. M. L. n. hydrogenum hydrogen, from Gr. n. hydor water and Gr. v. genein form or constitute; Gr. v.philein like, love; M. L. adj. hydrogenophilus that likes hydrogen)
Nonmotile, elongated oval cells, 1-1.3 by 2-3 μm.
Uses H2 and CO2 in addition to acetate, and may grow lithoautotrophically; slow growth occurs on ethanol.
The G+C content of the DNA is 45 mol%.
Biotin and paminobenzoate, and 2% NaCl and 0.3% MgCl/. 6 H2O are required.
Temperature range, 0-35°C optimum, 29-32°C pH range: 5.5-7.6, optimum, 6.6-7.0.
Type strain: AcRS1, DSM number 3380, deposited in the Deutsche Sammlung von Mikroorganismen, Göttingen,
